item.title: M. A. add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"I had been fed, in my youth, a lot of old wives' tales about the way men would instantly forsake a beautiful woman to flock around a brilliant one. It is but fair to say that, after getting out in the world, I had never seen this happen."
[From a column dated November 17, 1928]" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Gene Fowler
item.description: "Writing is easy. You only need to stare at a blank piece of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead." -- Gene Fowler

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't believe anything you read on the net. Except this. Well, including this, I suppose." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "It can hardly be a coincidence that no language on earth has ever produced the expression, 'As pretty as an airport." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Capital Letters Were Always The Best Way Of Dealing With Things You Didn't Have A Good Answer To." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I think you ought to know I'm feeling very depressed." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I think fish is nice, but then I think that rain is wet, so who am I to judge?" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The impossible often has a kind of integrity to it which the merely improbable lacks." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams (The Salmon of Doubt)
item.description:
"My favourite piece of information is that Branwell Brontë, brother of Emily and Charlotte, died standing up leaning against a mantle piece, in order to prove it could be done.
This is not quite true, in fact. My absolute favourite piece of information is the fact that young sloths are so inept that they frequently grab their own arms and legs instead of tree limbs, and fall out of trees.
However, this is not relevant to what is currently on my mind because it concerns sloths, whereas the Branwell Brontë piece of information concerns writers and feeling like death and doing things to prove they can be done, all of which are pertinent to my current situation to a degree that is, frankly, spooky." -- Douglas Adams (The Salmon of Doubt)

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: M. A. add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "Never lend books, for no one ever returns them; the only books I have in my library are books that other folks have lent me." -- Anatole France
